content: Now Jesus was also saying to the disciples,  [of his estate],  [against this man]  [master’s]   [of my affairs],  [my]   [of the estate]  [for a living],   [who are my master’s debtors]    [olive]    [not for his misdeeds, but]  [by preparing for his future unemployment];  [the non-believers]  [that is, to the ways of the secular world]  [the believers].  [learn from this],  [for eternity]  [that is, use material resources as a way to further the work of God],    [earthly wealth]  [whether God or man, and of which you are a trustee],   [that is, your earthly possessions or anything else you trust in and rely on instead of God].”
Now the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, were listening to all these things and were sneering  ridiculing Him.
